message_1: John wants to know how much to save from his monthly salary for his future educational expenses. He wants to save x percent of his salary, where x can be any real number between 0 and 100. However, if his monthly salary is less than or equal to 5000 dollars, he wants to save 20% of his salary. If his monthly salary is greater than 5000 dollars, he wants to save only 10% of his salary. Write down a mathematical expression that represents the amount John saves each month using fuzzy logic.
message_2:
Let S be John's monthly salary, and A be the amount John saves each month. We can represent the fuzzy logic using the min-max method as follows:

A(S) = min( max(0.2S, (S - 5000)/5000), max(0.1S, (10000 - S)/5000) )

This expression takes into account the fuzziness of the transition between saving 20% and 10% of his salary as his salary increases from 5000 to 10000 dollars.
